entities.name: her wand
entities.description: Hermione's wand is used to turn leaves on a crabapple tree to gold.

entities.name: trees
entities.description: Trees are present in the scene and Hermione's magic affects them.

entities.name: bushes
entities.description: Bushes are present in the scene and Hermione's magic affects them.

entities.name: ron
entities.description: Ron is a person who gives compliments to Hermione.

entities.name: hermione
entities.description: Hermione is the one using her wand and receiving compliments from Ron.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is a person who turns away, smiling to himself, after Hermione's magic.

entities.name: ginny
entities.description: Ginny is a person who catches Harry's eye and he grins at her.

entities.name: monsieur delacour
entities.description: Monsieur Delacour is a person with whom Harry strikes up a conversation.

entities.name: mrs. weasley
entities.description: Mrs. Weasley is a person who brings in a giant Snitch that turns out to be Harry's birthday cake.

entities.name: snitch
entities.description: A giant, beach-ball-sized Snitch appears to be floating in front of Mrs. Weasley.

entities.name: twelve fail-safe ways to charm witches
entities.description: Harry has a copy of this book and is looking for a chapter on compliments.

entities.name: crabapple tree
entities.description: A crabapple tree is present in the scene and Hermione's magic affects its leaves.

relationships.description: Hermione uses her wand to turn leaves on the trees to gold.
Ron gives compliments to Hermione for her magic.
Harry grins at Ginny after catching her eye.
Harry strikes up a conversation with Monsieur Delacour.
Mrs. Weasley carries the Snitch, which turns out to be Harry's birthday cake.
